definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
the Yongjiang river 甬江[Yong3 jiang1] through Ningbo 寧波|宁波[Ning2 bo1]/abbr. for Ningbo
variant of 桶[tong3], bucket/(classifier) cubic dry measure (5 pecks 五斗, approx half-liter)
path screened by walls on both sides
to read aloud with expression/to recite/to declaim
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
to read out/to recite/to remember sb (while talking about sth else)
Li Song, personal name of eleventh Tang emperor Shunzong 順宗|顺宗[Shun4 zong1] (761-806), reigned 805-806
variant of 弦誦不輟|弦诵不辍[xian2 song4 bu4 chuo4]
incessant playing of instruments and reciting of poems (idiom)
to chant the names of Buddha

sentences.english: Balladry says Song is not vocal only.
These three stanzas are also said to have been added by the reciters.
sentences.chinese: 这三段韵诗中据说也已补充到诵文中。

sentences.english: The most typical is the so-called "nursery rhyme", that children can recite the proliferation of those who pass.
sentences.chinese: 最典型的是所谓“童谣”，即儿童也能诵传扩散者。

sentences.english: Being able to chant fruits and review vocabularies of colors.
sentences.chinese: 会读诵水果韵文，并复习颜色的单字。

sentences.english: Flamand returns to sing the sonnet he has just composed.
sentences.chinese: 不久弗莱米德返回，诵唱他刚刚完成作曲的十四行诗。

sentences.english: So please recite sutras just for her.
sentences.chinese: 这样，请再专门为她诵一次经。

sentences.english: Listen to a cassette tape of a teaching by a great master, or a sacredchant.
sentences.chinese: 你可以听大师开示的录音带，或神圣的唱诵。

definition: to read aloud with expression/to recite/to declaim
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
to study the Confucian classics/to read scriptures or canonical texts
